alert.note: Alert for Huerfano; Las Animas; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 2:17PM MST until February 22 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Huerfano County in southeastern Colorado... Western Las Animas County in southeastern Colorado... Central Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 215 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Walsenburg, or 17 miles east of Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This band of snow will affect the entire I-25 corridor from Pueblo south to the New Mexico border. As this band moved across the Pueblo county area, over an inch of snow fell in the Pueblo West area. Locations impacted include... Pueblo, Trinidad, Walsenburg, Aguilar, Cokedale, Starkville, Salt Creek, Gulnare, Blende, Boncarbo, Segundo, Pueblo West, Colorado City and Weston. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
